attributes.action: Ensure that any Brexit deal cannot permanently tie us to the EU.
attributes.additional_details:
The referendum question:

Should the United Kingdom remain a member of the European Union or leave the European Union?

The result:

Votes	                            %
Leave	17,410,742	51.89%
Remain	16,141,241	48.11%
Valid votes	33,551,983	99.92%
Turnout	46,500,001	72.21%

As the result was to leave the EU, it is incumbent on all members of our government to implement the result.

Any current deal agreed between the UK and the EU must have a mechanism whereby it can be rescinded in all or part.
attributes.background:
During the lead up to the Brexit referendum our government informed the electorate that the result of the referendum would be honoured. 
The electorate voted to leave.
Leave means to leave with or without a deal. 
However, no deal should include anything that permanently ties the UK to the EU.
